overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a pragmatic approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It begins by evaluating advanced methods like SARIMA and Holt-Winters Exponential Smoothing but ultimately adopts a simplified weighted average technique due to data constraints. The method prioritizes capturing daily seasonality while emphasizing recent observations, resulting in a computationally efficient solution that addresses the challenge of forecasting 96 future points from only 4 days of history.
common_data_patterns: Complete data in provided history (no missing values)
key_insights: Daily seasonality (24-hour period) is the dominant pattern and primary forecasting basis
Short data length (4 days) limits complex model applicability, favoring simpler heuristics
Recent data receives higher weighting (0.1â†’0.4) to prioritize newer patterns
Forecast generation via repeating computed daily pattern for future days
Explicit handling of datetime continuity for future timestamps
complexity_analysis: Moderate initial complexity with statistical model consideration, transitioning to practical heuristics. Balances seasonality analysis and data limitations through weighted averaging, avoiding computationally intensive methods due to minimal training data.
